title: U.N. Watchdog Inspects a Site Flagged as Suspicious by Israelis-but Possibly Too Late
summary: A monthslong delay before the site was accessed could renew criticism about how aggressively the agency is policing Iran's nuclear activities. The United Nations' atomic agency has heeded calls by the U.S. and Israel to inspect a site that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu claimed last fall was housing Iranian nuclear equipment and material, according to officials familiar with the agency's work. But the visit may have come too late to yield proof of the claims.

title: The Buttigieg Appeal
summary: The mayor may sound moderate, but his vision is aggressively partisan.. Believe it or not, betting markets now rate Pete Buttigieg, the 37-year-old mayor of South Bend, Ind., in the top-tier of Democratic presidential candidates. He has about a 10% chance of winning the party's nomination-right behind Joe Biden, and well ahead of Sens. Elizabeth Warren, Cory Booker and Amy Klobuchar. His rise is a testament to changing American politics as well as his skill in packaging progressive policies and methods in a smooth, moderate persona.

title: The Muni-Bond Mania
summary: Look who's benefiting from the limit on state-and-local tax deduction.. Democratic politicians in the states love to blame the GOP tax reform for blowing holes in their budgets even as they quietly benefit from the new limitation on state-and-local tax deductions. Lo, investors seeking to reduce their tax liability are gobbling up municipal bonds, driving down yields and reducing government borrowing costs.

title: New Zealand Shooter to Face 50 Murder Charges
summary: Australia passes laws making it an offense for social-media platforms not to remove violent material swiftly. Three weeks after Christchurch shooter Brenton Tarrant live-streamed his mosque rampage on Facebook , authorities in New Zealand announced new charges against him and neighboring Australia passed laws to force social-media companies to remove violent or objectionable content.

title: Police Chiefs, Union Call on Prosecutor to Resign After Smollett Case
summary: Officials cite loss of confidence after charges dropped over actor's 'fake hate crime'. CHICAGO-The union representing Chicago police officers along with more than a dozen suburban chiefs of police called for the resignation of Cook County State's Attorney Kim Foxx, whose office last week dismissed all charges against actor Jussie Smollett.

title: Democracy Dwindles in Thailand
summary: The regime digs up a sedition charge against an opponent.. Thais had reason to hope last month that their country's first poll in eight years, despite its flaws, would bring more democracy to Southeast Asia's second-largest economy. This week gave them fresh reason to doubt after authorities targeted an opposition leader with a sedition charge.

title: Trump Picks Herman Cain for Fed
summary: Selection of Mr. Cain, along with proposed nomination of president's former campaign adviser Stephen Moore, marks effort to install Fed critics on central bank's seven-seat board. President Trump said Thursday he intends to nominate former GOP presidential candidate Herman Cain to the Federal Reserve's board of governors, signaling his desire to remake the nation's central bank after complaining about it for months.

title: If Biden Runs, They'll Tear Him Up
summary: The old Democratic Party was warm, like him. The new one rising is colder, less human and divisive.. Don't do it, Joe.

title: The Mueller 'Coverup' Gambit
summary: Why Barr is right to release the report with redactions and publicly, all at once.. The only surprising thing about the new "coverup" accusation against Attorney General William Barr is that it took it two weeks to get there. The question is whether Republicans fall for this naked effort to revive the collusion-and-obstruction narrative.

title: Judge Gives Musk, SEC Two Weeks to Strike Deal on Contempt Claims
summary: Tesla CEO says 'most likely' he'll be able to reach an agreement with securities regulators. A federal judge told Elon Musk and the U.S. government to craft a compromise that would avoid the need to determine whether the Tesla Inc. chief executive violated a court order governing his communications on social media.

title: The Climate Needs Nuclear Power
summary: If governors are serious about global warming, they'll preserve this vital source of clean energy.. Many environmentalists have changed their minds about nuclear energy over the past decade. While the share of energy produced by solar and wind has grown rapidly, nuclear remains America's largest source of clean, zero-emissions electricity. Anyone seriously interested in preventing dangerous levels of global warming should be advocating nuclear power.

title: Putting 'Soul' Back in the Hebrew Bible
summary: A new translation is impressive, but its take on nefesh misses something important.. Has the soul been taken from the Hebrew Bible? In the King James version, the word "soul" is very much in evidence. Perhaps most memorable is Psalm 23: "The Lord is my shepherd. . . . He restoreth my soul." But no more.

title: A Hindu Nationalist Wave May Lift Modi to Victory
summary: Conflict with Pakistan and media-savvy supporters have boosted the Indian prime minister's prospects.. Baghpat, India

title: 'How to Think Like a Roman Emperor' Review: Meditations for the Masses
summary: Marcus Aurelius is famous for his practice of Stoic philosophy. It would come in handy when one of his generals declared himself emperor.. In A.D. 175, a courier presented the emperor Marcus Aurelius with a letter from the Roman Senate. The news was not good: Marcus had been betrayed by the military commander Avidius Cassius, who had been hailed as emperor by the Egyptian legion in Alexandria. Marcus had recently been in poor health, and there were rumors-possibly spread by Cassius-that he was dead or dying. Now the frail and aging emperor had to prepare for war. As Donald Robertson writes, Marcus found himself "confronting one of the most serious crises of his reign."

title: Wynn Resorts CEO Is Pressed on What He Knew About Former Boss
summary: Matt Maddox tells Massachusetts gambling regulators what he recalled and did about allegations against Steve Wynn. BOSTON-Matt Maddox, chief executive of Wynn Resorts Ltd. , faced tough questioning from Massachusetts gambling regulators during hearings this week about his handling of sexual misconduct allegations against company founder Steve Wynn.

title: What 'Othello' Can Teach Us All
summary: Its treatment of race is uncomfortable but helps my students learn compassion.. For many years, I avoided teaching "Othello." I believed that the play, riddled with ethnic slurs and slights, was too much of a land mine and risked distracting students from Shakespeare's genius.

title: The Coming Trump Housing Crisis
summary: Instead of deregulating, he replicates the old rules and prepares another bust.. The Trump administration has finally turned its attention to housing policy. Unfortunately, the president's Memorandum on Housing Finance Reform, issued last week, is a major disappointment. It will keep taxpayers on the hook for more than $7 trillion in mortgage debt. And it is likely to induce another housing-market bust, for which President Trump will take the blame.

title: Biden Reaps the #MeToo Whirlwind
summary: 'It's never, never, never, never, never OK to touch her without her consent,' he told college men in 2011.. While speaking to students at the University of New Hampshire in 2011, then-Vice President Joe Biden told men in the audience that "no matter what a girl does, no matter how she's dressed, no matter how much she's had to drink-it's never, never, never, never, never OK to touch her without her consent."

title: Shortfall Found in Meredith's Oversight of Accounting Tied to Purchase of Time
summary: CONTENT FROM OUR SPONSOR. Meredith Corp. said its auditor, KPMG LLP, found material weakness of the magazine publisher's oversight of accounting related to its acquisition of Time Inc.

title: When Tech's Hottest Names Go Public, This Is Who They Call
summary: Julie Gao advised on stock sales that raised more than $20 billion last year, including seven of the 10 largest Chinese tech IPOs. HONG KONG-As a midlevel lawyer, Julie Gao was once seen as so crucial to one company's initial public offering that it worked her name into a contract, stating it would hire a different law firm if she left.

title: Jeff Bezos to Retain Voting Control of Wife's Amazon Shares After Divorce
summary: MacKenzie Bezos tweets that Jeff Bezos will keep all of Washington Post and Blue Origin stakes. Jeff and MacKenzie Bezos agreed to a divorce settlement that reduces his stake in Amazon.com Inc. but leaves the chief executive with voting control over Ms. Bezos' share.

title: Herman Cain Would Bring Unconventional Views to Fed
summary: On Thursday, Donald Trump chose the former Godfather's Pizza CEO as a nominee to the Federal Reserve Board. WASHINGTON-For the second time in two weeks, President Trump has chosen a nominee to the Federal Reserve Board who hails from outside mainstream economics circles and is seen as sympathetic to his goals.

title: FirstEnergy's Bankruptcy Deal With Power Units Collapses
summary: Bankruptcy judge rejects FirstEnergy Solutions $4 billion restructuring plan. A bankruptcy judge rejected FirstEnergy Corp.'s $3.1 billion attempt to walk away from a fleet of failing power plants, siding with regulators who want the parent company on the hook for pollution cleanup costs.

title: Trump Backs Off Threat to Shut Down Border With Mexico
summary: President warns he would seek tariffs on cars if Mexico doesn't stop illegal-drug flow. President Trump backed away Thursday from his recent threats to imminently close the U.S. border with Mexico to stop immigrant crossings, while also raising the possibility of imposing tariffs on cars.

title: At the Shed, Making Flexibility Visible
summary: The Shed, New York's newest arts space, takes the idea of malleable design to radical new places.. New York

title: 'What the Constitution Means to Me' Review: Less Than Perfect Union
summary: Heidi Schreck's play, based on a speech she wrote as a teenager, dresses up a feminist project with twee irony..

title: Both Parties Gear Up as Stacey Abrams Charts Her Next Move
summary: 'Not only is change coming to Georgia, change has arrived,' says 45-year-old Democrat. ATLANTA-Stacey Abrams is looking for her next move, causing ripple effects for both political parties in Georgia where shifting demographics are challenging a Republican stronghold.

title: House Democrats Could Face Long Haul in Pursuit of Trump Taxes
summary: The administration could attack the request as too broad. WASHINGTON-House Democrats want the IRS to provide them with President Trump's tax returns by next Wednesday, and they urged the tax agency's leaders to perform what one lawmaker called the mere "ministerial duty" of handing them over. But House members are also bracing for a dispute in federal court that could drag on for months or longer.

title: City Councilman Accused of Sexual Harassment
summary: Barry Grodenchik allegedly gave staffer unwanted attention, including kiss and hug. A New York City Council ethics committee has recommended a disciplinary hearing against a Queens councilman after it investigated allegations he sexually harassed a female member of his staff, officials said Thursday.

title: House Democrats Seek to Expand Domestic-Violence Bill
summary: Republicans say Democrats are trying to use the bill as political cover to tighten gun regulations. WASHINGTON-House Democrats' effort to prevent domestic abusers from possessing guns has roiled debate over a landmark domestic-violence bill that typically secures bipartisan support.

title: How Official's Undercover Role Led to Charges Against Billionaire
summary: North Carolina insurance commissioner and federal prosecutors teamed up to investigate entrepreneur Greg Lindberg. The bribery indictment that this week swept up the chairman of North Carolina's Republican Party and an insurance tycoon who is the state's largest political donor was sparked by a chance encounter at a gathering of state and federal officials.

title: 'Fosse/Verdon' Review: An Artist's Dark Side
summary: An FX series about the complex personal and professional lives of choreographer Bob Fosse and his artistic muse Gwen Verdon.. In one of the high moments of "Fosse/Verdon" (begins Tuesday, 10 p.m., FX), singers belt out the glorious "Heart" from "Damn Yankees." It's early in this eight-part series, writer Steven Levenson, but it's already obvious that there's not going to be a lot of heart, the feeling kind, in this portrait of Broadway choreographer Bob Fosse (Sam Rockwell), a womanizing star-a rendering clearly the product of our times. All that's missing in this story is some aspiring dancer suffering lost self-esteem, confused identity, and other permanent derangement because Fosse touched her hair without permission.

title: Dispute Mars Conclusion of NATO Anniversary Event in Washington
summary: U.S., Turkey disagreement continues over Russian air-defense system. An international gathering in Washington to mark the anniversary of the founding of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization ended on a note of discord Thursday because of a festering dispute between the U.S. and Turkey, two members of the post-World War II alliance.

title: Justice Department Defends Handling of Mueller Report
summary: Reports say investigators on Mr. Mueller's team believe the report is more critical of President Trump on whether he obstructed justice than Attorney General Barr indicated in his summary. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department defended its handling of special counsel Robert Mueller's report as Capitol Hill Democrats ratcheted up pressure to obtain the entire document by threatening to issue a subpoena in the coming days if their demands aren't met.

title: Notre Dame Coach Goes Viral With Attack on Gender Inequality
summary: Before the Women's Final Four, Muffet McGraw decries the lack of progress for women in coaching and politics. Notre Dame women's basketball coach Muffet McGraw made a splash in a recent interview by saying that she was no longer hiring men as assistant coaches. On Thursday at the NCAA women's Final Four, her views went viral when she delivered an impassioned two-minute speech decrying the lack of progress for women in coaching and politics.

title: Dollar Inches Higher After Strong Employment Data
summary: Initial jobless claims hit lowest level since 1969 on the day before the widely watched March employment report. The dollar rose slightly Thursday, boosted by strong U.S. employment data.

title: 'Reconstruction: America After the Civil War' Review: Progress and Obstruction
summary: This four-hour program created and hosted by Henry Louis Gates Jr. looks at the years following America's bloody conflict.. 'Reconstruction: America After the Civil War" (begins Tuesday, 9 p.m., PBS) is a remarkably broad view of the decades immediately following the Civil War-largely a hopeful time until 1915, when Jim Crow was firmly established. This four-part portrait created by Henry Louis Gates Jr., who also serves as host, draws from a bottomless-seeming treasury of period photos eloquent in their testimony. Here are the black Union soldiers in their uniforms, returning from the war, carrying their guns, and as one of the show's panel of historians puts it, they marched with a certain bearing, the kind that men who have served in the military often have-an unbearable sight to Southerners after the war, which caused the marchers to be set upon by mobs.

title: Amazon's Rise in Ad Searches Dents Google's Dominance
summary: Consumer-goods firms and retailers are among advertisers shifting dollars to Amazon, reflecting changing shopper behavior. Advertisers are starting to shift spending on search ads from Alphabet Inc.'s Google toward Amazon.com Inc., a sign of how the online retailer is capitalizing on becoming the top destination for consumers' product searches.

title: Gov. Murphy Worries Congestion-Pricing Plan Will Hurt New Jersey
summary: Concerns include further strain on state's struggling rail system, worse traffic in tunnels. New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy criticized New York's newly approved plan to charge a congestion fee on vehicles entering Manhattan's business district, saying it could treat commuters from his state unfairly.

title: The Ultimate Home Field Advantage
summary: San Francisco Giants' Mark Melancon is building a dream home in Mexico. Too busy to visit the site, the pitcher tweaked the design in Oracle Park. As a pitcher for the San Francisco Giants, Mark Melancon doesn't spend much time in the outfield. On a recent Sunday, he made an exception.

title: A Country's Concerns Caught on Screen
summary: A retrospective at the Japan Society highlights underknown filmmakers from the Japanese New Wave..

title: Tesla Shares Fall After Delivery Miss
summary: Slow start to deliveries in 2019 raises questions about demand and the electric-car maker's ability to meet sales targets. Shares of Tesla Inc. dropped about 8% Thursday after the electric-car maker reported worse-than-expected deliveries for the first quarter, raising concerns about demand for its older vehicles as well as its ability to get its newest offering into customers' hands.

title: Snap Pushes Into Gaming, Ratcheting Up Battle Royale With 'Fortnite'
summary: Messaging company aims to replicate the success of multiplayer games that double as online communities. WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.- Snap Inc. is getting into videogaming, joining other technology companies in a rush to attract users who are increasingly socializing in "Fortnite" and other multiplayer games that double as online communities.

title: Pete Buttigieg Walks Back His Use of 'All Lives Matter'
summary: Mayor of South Bend, Ind., speaks in New York at Sharpton event, where many presidential contenders are gathering this week. NEW YORK-Pete Buttigieg engaged in a rite of passage for Democratic presidential hopefuls Thursday, seizing the spotlight here at the Rev. Al Sharpton's National Action Network convention.

title: Stocks Rise as U.S.-China Trade Talks Continue
summary: Investors wait for signals on trade from Thursday meeting between the U.S. and China. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose Thursday as President Trump and Chinese officials prepared to meet in Washington to work toward resolving the continuing trade dispute, a major investor concern amid doubts around growth in the world's leading economies.

title: Three Drug Companies to Pay $122.6 Million to Resolve Kickback Allegations
summary: Jazz Pharmaceuticals, Lundbeck, Alexion reach agreement with the Justice Department. The Justice Department said on Thursday that three pharmaceutical companies- Jazz Pharmaceuticals PLC, Lundbeck LLC and Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc. ---agreed to pay a total of $122.6 million to resolve allegations they paid drug copays for their pharmaceuticals through copay-assistance foundations.

title: U.S. Government Bonds Inch Up
summary: Yields reverse course after overnight drop, partly on signs of progress in U.S.-China trade talks. U.S. government-bond prices ticked higher, as investors weighed poor German economic data against signs of progress in U.S.-China trade talks.

title: WSJ. Magazine Contributors: April 2019
summary: Writer Cullen Murphy contributed to this issue of the magazine. For writer Cullen Murphy and photographer Robert Polidori, getting a behind-the-scenes look at the works of Vatican City's Vatican Museums and the complex operation to conserve them made for an eye-opening trip. "I had been in the [Sistine] Chapel on two previous visits," says Polidori. "I was thrilled at the idea of being able to see the Michelangelo paintings without people all around me. The contrast in serenity is very noticeable." When Murphy got an up-close view of the frescoes, thanks to the Spider-a mobile platform on a telescopic arm that lifts conservators to the ceiling-the true scale of Michelangelo's masterpiece came fully into view. "Physically, the work was grueling," says Murphy. "He painted standing up, not on his back. He had to paint large figures from a few inches away. Looking at the ceiling, I found my thoughts returning to the man with the broken nose and this immense challenge in front of him."

title: WSJ. Magazine Editor's Letter: Drawing Inspiration
summary: Editor in Chief Kristina O'Neill introduces the April 2019 issue of WSJ. Magazine. Our April Style & Design issue features artists whose vision has, in one way or another, influenced their chosen medium, starting with a man who redefined portraiture from the Swinging '60s onward, David Bailey. What the Rolling Stones were to music, Bailey was to photography: raw, iconoclastic and utterly attuned to the spirit of London's youthquake. To mark Taschen's release of an oversize limited-edition monograph celebrating Bailey's oeuvre, our oral history draws on accounts from models, friends and old flames, offering a vibrant portrait of how the lensman worked.

title: Is Money Easy or Tight? It Depends on the Stock Market
summary: There are two ways to gauge how tight monetary policy is, but both come with drawbacks. It isn't quite true to say that monetary policy is all in the mind, but it isn't entirely false either. The Federal Reserve is subject to the whims of the markets, and that is rarely as obvious as in the past six months.

title: New York Buys Buildings to Serve as Permanent Housing for Homeless
summary: Cost of deal with Podolsky brothers has been questioned as high. New York City closed a $173 million deal Thursday to buy 17 Bronx and Brooklyn apartment buildings, officials said, an agreement that is expected to benefit some homeless families but has been scrutinized over its cost.

title: Senate Confirms Trump Pick to Lead Housing-Finance Overhaul
summary: Mark Calabria to play key role in shaping debate over future of Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac. WASHINGTON-The Senate confirmed Mark Calabria to oversee mortgage-finance companies Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac on Thursday, where he is set to play a critical role reshaping the way many Americans finance their home purchases.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended March 30
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: Market Signals Suggest Oil Rally Has Momentum
summary: Oil prices climbed this week above their longer-term average for the first time in 2019. Closely watched indicators in the oil market are boosting confidence that prices can continue to rebound, sparking bullish bets by investors ahead of the summer driving season.

title: Oil Closes Lower on Rising Supplies
summary: U.S. government data showed a rise in supplies last week. • Oil prices settled lower on Thursday, reversing earlier gains as traders weighed government data showed a rise in supplies.

title: 'Cockpit': From Fighting Birds to the Perch of Pilots
summary: The modern high-tech control center of an airplane, under examination in recent crashes, got its name from something very different. Boeing Co. has been forced to ground its 737 MAX aircraft after two of the jetliners were recently involved in deadly crashes in Indonesia and in Ethiopia. Much of the investigative focus has been on the cockpit systems of the planes, and whether pilots could have forestalled crashes with better cockpit controls.

title: 'Shazam!': 'Bang, Pow, Zowie' Is Fun Again
summary: A teenager in Philadelphia discovers he has the ability to turn himself into a bemuscled superhero in a film borne aloft by the power of wit. .. What "Shazam!" lacks most obviously is gravitas. And grimness. Also bleakness, darkness and relentless self-seriousness. In other words, it's terrific fun, and none of the things that were threatening to turn DC Entertainment into the cinematic equivalent of a black hole. Just when the world needs a superhero with a gift for silliness, here he is in a movie whose best superpower turns out to be a good heart.

title: 'Peterloo': An Orator Makes a Stand
summary: Mike Leigh's period piece about the 1819 Peterloo Massacre is a powerful portrait of a struggle for representation.. The closest thing to a conventional hero in Mike Leigh's remarkable "Peterloo" is an orator named Henry Hunt; he's played, in truly full cry, by Rory Kinnear. Hunt's high-decibel pipes, powered by radical passion, made him the equivalent of a rock star in early 19th-century England. He was the perfect choice to inspire a pro-democracy rally held 200 years ago at St. Peter's Field in Manchester, England. But Mr. Leigh's film, furiously impassioned in its own right, is also about the struggle for representation, the perils of dissent in the face of tyranny, the limits of oratory, and the flesh-and-blood cost of what came to be known infamously as the 1819 Peterloo Massacre, when a peaceful throng of more than 60,000 citizens was attacked by sword-swinging British cavalry troops.

title: As China Trade Deal Nears, U.S. Senators Fear It Could Fall Short
summary: Lawmakers critical of Beijing say pact has to ensure level playing field for U.S., enforcement mechanism. WASHINGTON-As the White House signals that a China trade deal is imminent, some U.S. senators are urging the Trump administration to ensure the pact mandates a level playing field for U.S. companies and has a strong enforcement mechanism.

title: Hemp Clothing Is Happening, and No, It Won't Get You High
summary: Once sullied by its associations with seedy drug culture, the irreproachable hemp plant is gaining ground in summer fabrics that rival wrinkly linen. LAST YEAR Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell signed his name on the 2018 Farm Bill using a pen made of hemp. Among other initiatives, the bill removed hemp from the Controlled Substances list, where it had languished since 1970. To address the elephant in the article: Hemp is not marijuana, its THC-potent sibling. It's a perfectly respectable (read: non-high inducing) plant that produces fibers for textiles, plastics, paper and a host of other products. The passing of the Farm Bill is the surest sign yet that hemp has shed its headshop connotations and entered the mainstream. Included in that transformation is its legitimacy as a valid, even desirable, fabric for modern clothing.

title: House Approves Lawsuit Challenging Trump's Border Declaration
summary: Legal challenge comes after unsuccessful legislative effort to block reallocation of funds to build wall. WASHINGTON-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif.) launched another attempt Thursday to block President Trump's efforts to redirect funding to a border wall with Mexico, saying her chamber approved filing a lawsuit challenging his national emergency declaration.

title: The Pastas You've Been Missing Out On...And Where to Find Them
summary: Straight out of Italy, pastas previously unknown to American diners offer a taste of authentic regional cooking. Venture beyond the same old spaghetti with our guide to noodle shapes trending now. NINE YEARS AGO, Los Angeles chef Evan Funke was eating lunch in a medieval village in Umbria when he peered inside the restaurant's kitchen to see an elderly woman tossing fragments of leftover bread dough into boiling water. She called the pasta strappatelle (from strappare, "to tear"). The pillowy dumplings were served in a simple tomato sauce for a staff meal. "When I went back five years later, the woman had died, without recording it in any way," Mr. Funke recalled. "So, I became the custodian of this shape."

title: Stronger Dollar Hurts Gold
summary: A rebound in Treasury yields in recent sessions has also weighed on gold prices. Gold prices fell, hurt by a stronger dollar as analysts monitored the latest trade talks between the U.S. and China.

title: Constellation Brands Gets a Boost From Beer Sales
summary: After wine divestiture, beverages producer to implement cost-cutting plan. Constellation Brands Inc. said sales rose in the latest quarter as stronger beer sales helped offset weakness in its lower-priced wine brands.

title: Financial Institutions Sued in U.S. Over Downed Malaysia Airlines Flight
summary: Family of U.S.-Dutch citizen alleges MoneyGram, Western Union, two Russian banks facilitated international campaign to raise funds for Ukrainian separatist movement. The family of an American killed in the crash of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 filed an antiterrorism lawsuit Thursday alleging that two prominent U.S. money transfer companies and two Russian banks were responsible for providing financial support to the pro-Russian separatists involved in the destruction of the plane.

title: Fed's Harker Sees at Most One Rate Rise in 2019, Another In 2020
summary: Leader of Philadelphia Fed remains in 'wait-and-see' mode as he judges economy. Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Patrick Harker said Thursday he still believes it's likely the central bank has some rate increases ahead of it.

title: Vatican Allows Guam Archbishop to Keep Rank Despite Child-Abuse Verdict
summary: "Zero tolerance" approach to sex abuse adopted by U.S. bishops is far from universal in the Catholic Church. ROME-An archbishop in Guam who was found guilty of sexual abuse of minors by a Vatican court and permanently removed from his post remains a priest with the rank of archbishop, underscoring wide inconsistencies in the Catholic Church's approach to abuse around the world.

title: Villanova: What Would St. Augustine Say?
summary: The question for Profs. Sheehan and Wilson is: "How can we hold professors accountable for their professional behavior?". Regarding Colleen A. Sheehan and James Matthew Wilson's "A Mole Hunt for Diversity 'Bias' at Villanova" (op-ed, March 30): I was a graduate student at Villanova from 1990-92. As a proud and vocal conservative on campus I was surprised at the vitriol and harassment I received from the faculty at this Catholic university. One of the few professors who saw me as an asset to the school was Prof. Sheehan.

title: An Example of Baltimore's Progressive Decline
summary: For the past 60 years, Baltimore has been a progressive's playground. (March 25) shines a light on one of the wrecking balls (eminent domain) used by progressives in Maryland to attack private property.

title: Congestion Pricing Will Hurt New York's Non-Rich
summary: Will the last middle-class person leaving New York City please turn off the lights.. Your editorial "New York's Pied-à-Terre Politics" (March 29) describing New York City's proposed revenue grabs mentions the proposed congestion-pricing plan for driving in mid- and lower Manhattan. I am a 76-year-old with limited mobility. The only way I can travel around the city is by taxi cab.

title: It Is Destructive to Blame Business for Making Profits
summary: Note to the senators: No one is in business for their health. And we can only pray that you understand the difference between profit and revenue.. Jon Hartley's "A 'Tiny' Tax on Trades Would Hobble Markets" (op-ed, April 1) contains an amazing revelation about the stance of the Democratic Party. Sens. Elizabeth Warren, Kirsten Gillibrand and Brian Schatz agree that it is a problem for financial firms to "skim profit off the top" with frequent trades; thus they back a "tiny tax" on this activity.

title: Interior Nominee Bernhardt Clears Another Hurdle
summary: Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee votes to advance David Bernhardt, Interior's current acting secretary, to a full Senate vote. WASHINGTON-President Trump's nominee to lead the Interior Department moved closer to confirmation Thursday with overwhelming committee approval that included support from several Democrats.

title: A Man of Mystery Revealed by His Books
summary: The library in a vacation house is full of odd and fascinating titles. But what do they say about their owner?.

title: House Passes Resolution to End U.S. Role in War in Yemen
summary: Vote sets up second veto of Trump administration. WASHINGTON-The House passed a resolution that would end U.S. military assistance for the Saudi-led war in Yemen, a move to admonish the Trump administration over its support for Saudi Arabia that is likely to provoke the second veto of President Trump's tenure.

title: Mormon Church to Allow Baptisms of Children of Same-Sex Couples
summary: Church seeks greater inclusion of LGBT people, while still considering gay marriage a 'serious transgression'. The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints announced Thursday that it would allow children of married same-sex parents to be baptized as part of a reversal of a 2015 policy that labeled gay couples as apostates-or those who have renounced the faith.

title: Treasury to Sell $156 Billion in Debt
summary: U.S. Treasury Department will auction next week $38 billion in new debt and $118 billion in previously sold debt. title: Netanyahu Meets With Putin, Gains in Polls Before Israeli Vote
summary: Israeli leader, touting his statesmanship, meets Russian leader following recent huddles with President Trump and Brazil's Bolsonaro. TEL AVIV-Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow to thank him for help finding a long-missing Israeli soldier's remains, capping over a week of high-profile diplomatic huddles as some polls showed him gaining ground before Israel's election on Tuesday.

title: Wall Street Bankers No Longer Fully Vested
summary: Patagonia is refusing to make fleece vests for greedy bankers, but Wall Street may find a workaround. They have gone from fashion statement to dorky stereotype. Can they become a status symbol?

summary: The prize, open to artists who live or work in Brooklyn, also includes a museum exhibit and public installation. The Brooklyn Museum features artists from around the world, but for its first ever artist's prize, the more than a century-old institution is keeping it local.

title: Fed's Mester Says Rate Increases Still Possible
summary: Official expects more growth and strong job markets. Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Loretta Mester said Thursday it remains possible the U.S. central bank might raise rates again.

And who is in charge?

title: America's Amazing Job Market
summary: The NFIB March survey shows small businesses hiring at close to a record pace.. U.S. small businesses continued their aggressive hunt for new workers and added employees at a near-record pace in March. That's according to the latest employment report from the National Federation of Independent Business, due out later today.

title: A $39.9 Million Manhattan Penthouse Enters Tough Market
summary: At a time when New York real estate is struggling with an oversupply of luxury condos, developer Ceruzzi Properties lists a duplex at the Centrale.. A duplex penthouse at the Centrale, an over 800-foot residential skyscraper under construction in Midtown Manhattan, is coming on the market for $39.9 million.

title: The Star-Maker of Paris
summary: Toulouse-Lautrec became famous for his bold images of nightclub performers. Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec (1864-1901) was the Andy Warhol of late 19th-century Paris-a chronicler of celebrity and nightlife who mixed high art with popular culture. It's little wonder that he is so popular in our own celebrity-obsessed age: Toulouse-Lautrec exhibitions recently took place in Edinburgh and Barcelona, and a big show is scheduled for Paris this fall. Now Americans will have a chance to experience his work thanks to "Toulouse-Lautrec and the Stars of Paris," a new show opening April 7 at the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston, which focuses on the cabaret dancers and singers whom the artist celebrated.

title: Adidas to Relaunch Beyoncé's Ivy Park Line
summary: Partnership marks another high-profile pairing of an entertainer with an athletic-goods company. BERLIN- Adidas AG said Thursday it has named music icon Beyoncé́as a creative partner and would relaunch her activewear line Ivy Park under the German sportswear brand, the latest high-profile pairing of an entertainer with an athletic-goods company.

title: Tariffs Take Center Stage in U.S.-China Trade Talks
summary: Trump administration's demand that punitive levies remain to ensure Beijing enacts genuine overhauls has emerged as one of the biggest sticking points as negotiators meet in Washington. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration's demand that punitive tariffs remain to ensure Beijing enacts genuine overhauls has emerged as one of the biggest sticking points, as U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators opened new face-to-face talks aimed at a deal.

title: Is Jeep's 2020 Gladiator Worth the Climbing Costs?
summary: The new Jeep Gladiator-the brand's first pickup since 1992- shares all of the Wrangler's charms and many of its flaws. But is it worth the inflated price? Dan Neil drives the unique beast through the California mountains to find out. I DON'T KNOW what brand of machine the U.S. Treasury Department uses, but Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) prints money with Jeep. The latest denomination to roll off the presses in Toledo, Ohio, is the 2020 Jeep Gladiator: a midsize pickup, based on the Wrangler four-door compact SUV (body-on-frame construction, solid front and rear axle), a 5-foot cargo bed, fold-down tailgate and best-in-class towing. Ka-Ching.

title: Ohio Rep. Ryan Enters 2020 Presidential Race
summary: Nine-term congressman becomes 17th Democrat to seek nomination. WASHINGTON-Ohio Rep. Tim Ryan is running for president, making the nine-term congressman the 17th Democrat to enter the 2020 race.

title: Why Cannabis Legalization Could Decide Israel's Next Prime Minister
summary: The kingmaker in forming a coalition government may well be a small far-right party that backs deregulated marijuana. Beyond the future of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and everything else at stake in Israel's April 9 election, the Jewish state also seems poised, in distinctly Israeli fashion, to legalize the recreational use of marijuana. Understanding why requires a journey into the intricacies of Israel's raucous electoral system-and shows how desperate Israel's clashing political blocs are for every vote in an election that pollsters expect to be tight.

title: Brown Is Back: How to Incorporate Seasoned Furniture Without Dating Your Home
summary: Interior designers no longer dismiss 'brown furniture' as vintage wood pieces that have no pedigree. Instead, they elevate them as crucial elements of décor. THE FURNITURE at San Francisco designer Justin Colombik's grandparents' house in Highland Park, Ill., was what you might see at a funeral home, he said: a faux-Chippendale dining table here, a pair of Hollywood Regency-style coffee tables there. Still, when his grandparents moved to Florida, Mr. Colombik showed up with a U-Haul and filled it with furniture.

title: Why You Should Let Children Know About Their Inheritance
summary: Retirement columnist Glenn Ruffenach also answers questions about second careers and IRA contents. I have never been comfortable talking about money with my adult children, but my wife and I are making some changes to our estate plan. Our question: Should we talk with our children about their inheritance? Have you tackled this issue?

title: China's Fishing Militia Swarms Philippine Island, Seeking Edge in Sea Dispute
summary: The boats' presence is illegal and violates Manila's sovereignty, the Philippines foreign ministry says. HONG KONG-Chinese fishing vessels have swarmed the waters around a Philippine-controlled island in the South China Sea in recent months-sparking fears in Manila that Beijing is trying to assert greater control in a disputed area.

title: Apple Didn't Fix the Charging Mess, Nor Has Anybody Else
summary: The best gadget to wirelessly charge your other gadgets doesn't exist: Columnist Joanna Stern explains how physics beat the Apple AirPower. Under my nightstand lives a terrifying creature with tentacle-like wires: One for my iPhone, one for my Apple Watch, one for my AirPods, one for my Kindle and one for my MacBook. When I drift off to sleep, it grabs me, trying to pull me into the Upside Down-until Apple's AirPower swoops in to rescue me by slicing through the cords.

title: The Potential Kingmaker in Israel: An Ultranationalist Who Wants to Legalize Pot
summary: Polls suggest Moshe Feiglin could crown Netanyahu or rival Gantz prime minister after campaigning to legalize marijuana, annex West Bank and strip away Palestinian voting rights. Moshe Feiglin wants Israelis to be able to smoke a joint without legal consequences. He also wants Israel to annex the entire West Bank and strip non-Jews of their voting rights unless they pledge loyalty to the state.

title: There Is Now Scientific Proof Your Cat Is Ignoring You
summary: New study finds felines can distinguish their names, even if they don't come when called; twitching ears. Researchers spent months getting to the bottom of an eternal question: Is my cat ignoring me?

title: Does Your Smartphone Know if You're Depressed?
summary: Researchers seek out 'behavioral biomarkers' for mental illness; facial expressions, voice and language may offer clues. Depressed patients don't enunciate vowels as much as people who aren't depressed. Their smiles are smaller. Suicidal individuals who speak in a breathy voice rather than a tense tone are more likely to re-attempt suicide. And patients with psychotic disorders, such as one form of schizophrenia, raise their eyebrows often when averting their gaze.

title: New York City Venture Capital Deals Topped $9 Billion in 2017
summary: New York-based companies closed nearly 1,000 deals in 2017. New York City's diverse range of businesses are keeping the city at the forefront of venture-capital fundraising in the U.S., even as foreign metropolises capture a growing share of investor cash, according to a new analysis from the city comptroller's office.

title: Tesla's First-Quarter Deliveries Plummet
summary: Electric car maker faces challenges shipping Model 3 overseas for the first time. Tesla Inc. said new-vehicle deliveries in the first quarter fell 31% from the previous three months as the electric-car maker struggled to ship its Model 3 compact car to customers in Europe and China for the first time.

title: How Theaster Gates Has Changed Chicago
summary: The prolific artist, whose community-focused projects have revitalized Chicago's South Side, has a new show in his home city.. In this series, we get the inside story from artists about their upcoming exhibitions and installations-plus, learn about their mantras, rituals and what they're up to next.

title: The Basketball Coach Who Went Back to School
summary: Earl Watson, a former UCLA basketball star, is back on campus to finish his degree and prepare for a career as a college coach. Los Angeles

title: IVF Often Doesn't Work. Could an Algorithm Help?
summary: Researchers and startups are studying whether artificial intelligence can do a better job of choosing embryos that lead to pregnancy. Trying to get pregnant with in vitro fertilization is a gamble. But some fertility doctors think artificial intelligence could help tilt the odds in their patients' favor.

title: How JFK Sent the U.S. to the Moon
summary: President Kennedy's challenge to the nation led to a space-race victory he didn't live to see. On the afternoon of May 25, 1961, members of Congress assembled in a joint session at the U.S. Capitol to hear President John F. Kennedy's highly anticipated special address on "Urgent National Needs." After describing the Soviets' success in building powerful rockets and satellites, Kennedy astonished his audience, and the world, by tying his New Frontier agenda to a lunar mission: "I believe this nation should commit itself to achieving the goal, before the decade is out, of landing a man on the moon and returning him safely to Earth."

title: German Manufacturing Slump Piques Fears Over Europe's Flagship Economy
summary: The slowdown is bad news for the rest of Europe, where a return of economic hardship could prove a boon for populists. FRANKFURT-German manufacturers saw orders drop sharply in February, increasing the likelihood that Europe's flagship economy could contract in the first half of 2019 in a setback for a weakened continent.

title: Teradyne Appoints New CFO Ahead of Expansion
summary: New finance chief Sanjay Mehta joins from Qualcomm. Teradyne Inc. on Thursday named a new finance chief, as the manufacturer of automation equipment plans to expand its test equipment and industrial applications businesses.

title: Three Winemaking Consultants on the Places and Products They Love Most
summary: Often called "flying winemakers" because of their travel-heavy careers, these experts are valued for their exact palates and knowledge. Here, they share the personal tastes that shape their vinicultural vision. Though Heidi Barrett, 61, doesn't jet-set between continents-her eight clients are all located in Napa Valley, California-she might have the most legitimate claim to the title "flying winemaker": A licensed helicopter pilot, she is able to travel between wineries in a 2007 Robinson R44. The daughter of a well-known winemaker father and an artist mother, Barrett had early training in the craft. "In our house there were always wines we could taste," she says. "My sister and I got to have a couple sips with dinner." After serving as winemaker at Buehler Vineyards, she went freelance in 1988 and began working with Dalla Valle Vineyards, where she achieved two rare 100-point scores in Robert Parker's Wine Advocate. She also got several perfect scores at Screaming Eagle and Grace Family Vineyards. Although she now works with multiple clients, including Paradigm Winery and Amuse Bouche, Barrett is so deeply involved with each that she sees herself as an independent winemaker rather than a consultant.

title: New York Fed President Says Outlook for Economy Remains Strong
summary: Remarks emphasize economy is doing well, pushing back at pessimistic view held by many in financial markets. The president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York said Thursday the outlook for the economy remains strong, in comments that offered no hints about what's next for central-bank interest-rate policy.

title: ECB Officials Discussed More Aggressive Stimulus at March Policy Meeting
summary: Some officials said central bank shouldn't raise rates before March 2020, minutes show. FRANKFURT-European Central Bank officials discussed more aggressive stimulus measures to support Europe's stalling economy at their latest policy meeting, and signaled they could take fresh action to shore up growth at coming meetings.

title: CVS, Walgreens Look to the Chronically Ill for a Pharmacy Cure
summary: The chains are hoping to reverse their sagging fortunes by turning drugstores into go-to treatment centers. America's two biggest pharmacy chains are attempting to reverse their sagging fortunes by becoming go-to treatment centers for people with chronic illnesses.

title: Shipping Comes to Terms With $50 Billion Clean-Fuel Bill
summary: A shift from heavy oil to lower-sulfur fuels next year will hit vessel operators and cargo owners, but preparations are finally taking shape. The introduction of low-sulfur fuels in oceangoing vessels next year to meet new emissions standards will mark the biggest change in ship propulsion since the maritime industry moved from coal to heavy oil early in the 20th century.

title: Walmart, Other Employers Get Choosy on Workers' Doctors
summary: Resume Subscription. Walmart Inc. and other employers want more say over which doctors care for their workers, and they are ramping up efforts to pick and choose physicians included in health plans as they seek to reduce health spending.

title: Stocks to Watch: Tesla, Constellation Brands, Red Robin
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Thursday's session. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Thursday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Why Design Is Embracing Organic
Why Design Is Embracing Organic
'It Was Scary as Hell': The Rearrest of Carlos Ghosn Opens New Front in Inquiry
summary: Prosecutors in Tokyo for the first time brought forth specific suspicions that the former executive pocketed Nissan money. TOKYO-When Carlos Ghosn, still in his pajamas, heard the doorbell of his Tokyo apartment ring at 5:50 Thursday morning, he knew his brief month of freedom was about to end, said his wife, Carole.

title: Jobless Claims Dropped to Lowest Level Since 1969
summary: Initial claims, a proxy for layoffs across the U.S., decreased to 202,000, the latest sign of a tight labor market. WASHINGTON-The number of Americans filing applications for new unemployment benefits fell last week to the lowest level in half a century, the latest sign of a tight labor market.

title: Why I'm Not Flipping Out About Bat Flips
summary: Baseball's post-home run celebratory gesture is viewed by some as an insult. It isn't. That much. Really.. How do you feel about bat flips in baseball? You're supposed to have a very strong opinion.

title: Saudi Aramco Pushes for Low Yield on Debut Bond
summary: The oil giant wants investors to accept yields on its bonds on par with the Saudi government. Investors considering whether to invest in Aramco's much-anticipated bond debut say the oil giant is pushing for especially low yields, despite concerns about the role of the Saudi state in the company's finances.

title: Sears, After Years of Closures, to Open Three Small-Format Stores
summary: New locations will be fraction of the size of typical Sears, focus on tools and appliances. After closing hundreds of locations in recent years, Sears plans to open three smaller stores in May in an attempt to reclaim shoppers by selling tools, appliances and other hard goods.

title: Condé Nast Names Former Pandora Boss as New CEO
summary: Roger Lynch, who previously led Dish's Sling TV, will be tasked with combining magazine publisher's disparate businesses. Condé Nast has tapped veteran media executive Roger Lynch as its new global chief executive as the publisher of Vogue, Vanity Fair and the New Yorker combines its U.S. and U.K. businesses during a challenging period for print and digital advertising.

title: Pope Names As New Archbishop to Head Troubled D.C. Church
summary: Wilton Gregory takes over after Cardinal Wuerl resigned over criticism of his handling of clerical sex abuse. ROME-Pope Francis has named Archbishop Wilton Gregory of Atlanta as the new leader of the Catholic Church in Washington, D.C., making him the first African-American to assume the post.

title: India's Central Bank Cuts Key Lending Rate to 6.0%
summary: Resume Subscription. MUMBAI-India's central bank cut its main lending rate for the second time this year as recent low inflation rates gave it the freedom to try to bolster economic growth.

title: A First German ECB Chief? It Looks Increasingly Likely
summary: Prospect of a hawkish central bank leader coincides with an economic slowdown in Europe, potentially spooking markets. Germany is edging toward a prize it has coveted for two decades: The presidency of the European Central Bank.

title: Economists Expect Hiring Rise, Wage Gains in March Jobs Report
summary: Economists expect hiring warmed up after February's dismal rise of 20,000; wage gains possible. The U.S. government releases its broad accounting of the March job market on Friday. Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal expect the Labor Department to report that employers added a seasonally adjusted 175,000 jobs during the month, while the unemployment rate held at 3.8%. Here are five things to watch in the report.

title: The Berkshire Empire Is Quietly Collaborating More Than Ever
summary: Rise in communication among senior leaders offers glimpse at future of conglomerate when Warren Buffett no longer runs it. The myriad companies of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. have run completely independently of each other for decades. That isn't always the case any longer.

title: Luxury Brands Snub Amazon but Cozy Up to Alibaba
summary: Labels are increasingly willing to work with Chinese e-commerce giants. Despite being fussy about their image, luxury brands are teaming up with mass-market Chinese e-commerce giants Alibaba and JD.com . Don't expect them to act as friendly toward Amazon.

title: Why Yahoo's Heir Is Finally Giving Up on Alibaba
summary: Altaba has decided to liquidate the Alibaba stake bought by Yahoo in 2005, even if it means paying billions of dollars in taxes. It's said that nothing is certain except death and taxes. After years of trying to avoid the latter, Altaba has finally accepted it will face both.

title: Banking Giants Are Mortgaging China's Future
summary: Chinese banks are still writing ever more mortgages, leaving households increasingly indebted. Lending for real-estate purchases in China is still on the up: Recently published accounts show mortgage credit making up an ever-larger share of total loan books at three of the country's four largest banks.

title: Renault Board Says Probe Finds Questionable Expenses
summary: French auto maker also accuses ex-CEO Carlos Ghosn of ethical violations for the first time. PARIS-Renault SA said a probe of its alliance with Nissan Motor Co. has found what could be millions of euros in questionable expenses, as the French auto maker accused Carlos Ghosn, its former chief, of ethical violations for the first time.

title: Tencent Closes Asia's Biggest Dollar-Bond Sale in a Year
summary: Chinese internet giant priced $6 billion in bonds that mature in five, seven, 10 and 30 years. Internet giant Tencent Holdings Ltd. has added to a wave of borrowers locking in low interest rates, selling $6 billion of bonds in Asia's biggest sale of dollar debt in over a year.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Man Found in Kentucky Isn't Boy Who Vanished in 2011, FBI Says
summary: Tale of being same person as 6-year-old boy who vanished in 2011 is now seen as hoax. Hopes that an Illinois boy missing since 2011 had been found alive in Kentucky were dashed after the Federal Bureau of Investigation said the boy's DNA didn't match that of a person who claimed to be him and said he had just escaped two kidnappers.

title: Pilots Take Aim at Instructions for Boeing 737 MAX
summary: Preliminary findings from last month's Ethiopia crash are expected to stoke criticism that Boeing, FAA didn't do enough to warn pilots after first disaster. Some pilots inside and outside the U.S. are expressing concern that crews should have been provided more-detailed instructions about disabling a suspect flight-control system after the first fatal crash of a Boeing Co. 737 MAX airliner in Indonesia.

title: Irrational Exuberance Endangers China's Nasdaq
summary: Beijing's paternalistic approach to market regulation has bred serious moral hazards in mainland markets. China is having another go at creating its own version of Nasdaq, a marketplace for the country's best technology stocks. But first, it needs to teach its investors that share prices can go down as well as up.

title: Trump Likely to Announce Plans for Summit With China's Xi on Thursday
summary: Move is signal that contentious trade talks between the two countries may be nearing conclusion. WASHINGTON-President Trump may announce plans for a summit with China's President Xi Jinping on Thursday when he meets with the country's vice premier, signaling that contentious trade talks between the two countries may be nearing conclusion.

title: Verizon, South Korea Launch Smartphone 5G
summary: Global carriers see being first in 5G as a way to flex their technical prowess, though few consumers are influenced by such distinctions when choosing a provider. The 5G era for smartphones began on Wednesday, providing the world's first glimpses at what the much-hyped network technology can offer consumers and how much the speed upgrade will cost.

title: States Sue Trump Administration Over Rollback of School-Lunch Nutrition Standards
summary: As USDA seeks to ease Obama-era rules on whole-grain foods and sodium content, Democratic attorneys general challenge on administrative grounds. WASHINGTON-Six states and the District of Columbia sued the Trump administration in federal court on Wednesday for attempting to ease school-lunch nutrition standards.

title: Carlos Ghosn Is Arrested Again on Fresh Suspicions
summary: Ghosn was released on bail March 6 after being charged with financial crimes. TOKYO-Former Nissan Motor Co. Chairman Carlos Ghosn was arrested again in Tokyo early Thursday over new suspicions of financial misconduct less than a month after he was released on bail.

title: Tesla Delivers a Dud
summary: Tesla unveiled disappointing delivery numbers and more logistical headaches during the first quarter that probably mean it wasn't profitable. After two consecutive quarters of profits, the growth story at Tesla Inc. is suddenly in tatters.

title: PG&E Chooses TVA Head as Next CEO
summary: Troubled California utility also announces new board slate, as it seeks to recover from wildfire problems that pushed it to seek bankruptcy protection. PG&E Corp. on Wednesday named Bill Johnson, the current head of the Tennessee Valley Authority, as its next chief executive and announced a new board, as it seeks to steer a path out of bankruptcy.

title: H.I.G. Capital to Buy Weight-Loss Brand Jenny Craig
summary: Miami-based firm is set to acquire the business from private-equity peer North Castle Partners. Private-equity firm H.I.G. Capital is acquiring weight-loss brand Jenny Craig, said a person familiar with the matter.

title: Trump's Tax Returns Requested by House Panel Chairman
summary: Rep. Richard Neal invoked law that allows House Ways and Means Committee chair to obtain any person's tax information. The chairman of the House tax-writing committee formally requested President Trump's tax returns on Wednesday, kicking off what could be a bruising legal fight between Congress and the Trump administration.

title: Biden Says He Will Be 'Much More Mindful' of Personal Space After Women's Accusations
summary: Video statement comes after allegations that he touched women in inappropriate manner. WASHINGTON-Joe Biden pledged to be "more mindful and respectful of people's personal space," as the former vice president signaled he is still moving toward joining the 2020 presidential primary.

title: Icahn Sold Lyft Stake to George Soros Prior to IPO
summary: Icahn had roughly 2.7% stake, worth about $550 million at IPO price. Carl Icahn sold his roughly 2.7% stake in Lyft Inc. to fellow billionaire George Soros ahead of the ride-hailing company's initial public offering last week, according to people familiar with the matter.
